Description: Fragment, including rim, of an Egyptian(izing) glazed composition 'common bowl' of approximately 13 cm diameter; mould-made or -pressed and covered with a blue glaze; black/brown painted line around the rim, with remains of a lotus decoration within; fragment is made up of many sherds.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Hala Sultan Tekke, Tomb II
Curator's comments: See E. Peltenburg, 'Hathor, faience and copper on Late Bonrze Age Cyprus', CCEC 37 (2007), 375-394 on the Egyptian 'common bowl' on Cyprus.
Bibliographic references: Bailey 1976 / Hala Sultan Tekke I. Excavations 1897-1971 (p.10, pl. IIIg, h)
Jacobsson 1994 / Aegyptiaca from Late Bronze Age Cyprus (No. 196)
